channel.title: NYT > World
channel.copyright: Copyright 2014 The New York Times Company

item.title: U.S. Strikes Militants Besieging Turkmen in Iraq
item.description: American planes struck the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, and dropped food, water and aid near the northern town of Amerli.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By HELENE COOPER

item.title: Ukraine President Says Europe’s Security Depends on Stopping Russia
item.description: President Petro O. Poroshenko of Ukraine won no pledges of military assistance from the European Union, but his warnings helped set the stage for a new round of sanctions against Russia.
item.dc:creator: By ANDREW HIGGINS and NEIL MacFARQUHAR
item.media:credit: Mauricio Lima for The New York Times
item.media:description: Ukrainian militiamen secured an area on the outskirts of Mariupol, where a Russian-backed assault was expected.

item.title: Facing Hard-Liners and Sanctions, Iran’s Leader Toughens Talk
item.description: In the second year of Hassan Rouhani’s presidency, he has struck a new tone, echoing the longstanding Iranian view that the United States can never be trusted.
item.dc:creator: By THOMAS ERDBRINK
item.media:description: President Hassan Rouhani called the United States on Saturday the biggest obstacle to finding agreement on nuclear talks after it imposed new sanctions on Iran.

item.title: An Artist Is Rebuked for Casting South Korea’s Leader in an Unflattering Light
item.description: The artist Hong Sung-dam lashed out at an elite he considers responsible for a deadly ferry disaster, and has faced censorship he likens to his treatment during years of dictatorship.
item.dc:creator: By CHOE SANG-HUN
item.media:credit: Jean Chung for The New York Times
item.media:description: The artist Hong Sung-dam with a replica of “Sewol Owol,” which was pulled from the Gwangju Beinnale for its parodies of the president.

item.title: As Scots Weigh Independence, Wales Takes Note
item.description: Welsh nationalists have made the Scottish independence bid their own in the hope that it will stir passions at home — if not for full independence, at least for more self-government.
item.dc:creator: By KATRIN BENNHOLD
item.media:credit: Andrew Testa for The New York Times
item.media:description: Welsh flags flying in Caernarfon. Eight in 10 people speak the native Celtic tongue in this coastal town, where many carry names their fellow Britons would not dare pronounce.

item.title: John A. Walker Jr., Ringleader of Spy Family, Dies at 77
item.description: Mr. Walker was a Navy communications specialist when he began spying for the Soviets at the height of the Cold War in 1967.
item.dc:creator: By WILLIAM YARDLEY
item.media:description: John A. Walker Jr., left, with a marshal in 1985, pleaded guilty to leading an espionage ring that sold codes to the Soviets.

item.title: John Edwin Mroz, Who Held Secret Talks With Arafat for the Reagan Administration, Dies at 66
item.description: Mr. Mroz was a co-founder and chief executive of the EastWest Institute, a New York-based group specializing in international conflict resolution.
item.dc:creator: By BRUCE WEBER

item.title: Pakistani Opposition Clashes With the Police
item.description: Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif said Saturday that he would not resign and called the demands to do so by his opponents “unacceptable” and “unconstitutional.”
item.dc:creator: By SALMAN MASOOD
item.media:description: Police officers during protests in front of Parliament in Islamabad on Friday. Two major opposition politicians have led demonstrators in calling for the resignation of Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif.

item.title: In Nod to Eastern Europe, E.U. Names Poland Premier to Key Post
item.description: The selection is the latest sign that Poland is emerging as a larger player in European affairs, particularly on issues involving the bloc’s eastern front.
item.dc:creator: By JAMES KANTER

item.title: Syrian Rebels Trade Fire With Troops From U.N.
item.description: Gunfire broke out on Saturday between United Nations peacekeepers in southern Syria and the Islamist rebels who had been surrounding their base near the Israeli-occupied Golan Heights.
item.dc:creator: By BEN HUBBARD

item.title: Lesotho Military Moves on Police
item.description: The country’s prime minister said the actions amounted to a coup, although a spokesman for the army said the soldiers were only securing the country.
item.category: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
item.dc:creator: By ADAM NOSSITER

item.title: ISIS Militants Behead Lebanese Soldier and Hold 18 More
item.description: A video posted on social media sites on Saturday showed members of the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria beheading a soldier captured when militants seized a Lebanese border town.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By REUTERS

item.title: George Galloway, British Lawmaker, Is Released From Hospital After Attack
item.description: A spokesman for George Galloway, known for his vocal criticism of Israel, said the attack on Friday was related to his declaration that a city in northern England was an “Israel-free zone.”
item.dc:creator: By MARK SCOTT

item.title: Palestinian May Push for Deadline to End Occupation
item.description: The president of the Palestinian Authority may use the annual United Nations General Assembly to publicly demand an end date for Israel’s occupation.
item.dc:creator: By RICK GLADSTONE
item.media:description: Riyad H. Mansour, before the Security Council in July, said there is a plan for calling for an end to the Israeli occupation.

item.title: 22 Miners Freed in Nicaragua as Rescue Efforts Continue
item.description: Rescuers have saved 22 of at least 26 miners trapped after a gold and silver mine collapsed on Thursday.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS
item.media:description: Leber Vivas Gonzales, 16, center right, after his rescue from the El Comal gold and silver mine in Bonanza, Nicaragua, late on Friday.

item.title: Attack Kills 12 at Afghan Compound
item.description: A dozen people were killed when insurgents attacked the headquarters of the Afghan intelligence service in this eastern city Saturday.
item.dc:creator: By KHALID ALOKOZAI and ROD NORDLAND

item.title: ISIS Displaying a Deft Command of Varied Media
item.description: ISIS, the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, is using every contemporary mode of messaging to recruit fighters, intimidate enemies and promote its claim to have established a caliphate.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By SCOTT SHANE and BEN HUBBARD
item.media:description: An image posted Friday by ISIS on its Twitter account shows a suicide bomb attack.

item.title: World Briefing: Afghanistan: 6 Killed in Assault on Intelligence Office in Jalalabad
item.description: Insurgents attacked the headquarters of the Afghan intelligence service in Jalalabad, in the country’s east, setting off a huge bomb that killed at least six people and wounded 45 others, Afghan officials said.
item.dc:creator: By KHALID ALOKOZAI and ROD NORDLAND

item.title: World Briefing: Central America Hit by Severe Drought
item.description: A severe drought has ravaged crops in Central America, and as many as 2.8 million people are struggling to feed themselves, the United Nations World Food Program said Friday.
item.dc:creator: By REUTERS

item.title: Werner Franz, Survivor of the Hindenburg’s Crew, Dies at 92
item.description: Mr. Franz was a 14-year-old cabin boy when the immense German zeppelin erupted into flames. He was believed to be the last surviving member of the crew.
item.dc:creator: By BRUCE WEBER

item.title: Ahmed Seif, Who Was Tortured in Egypt and Became Rights Defender, Dies at 63
item.description: Mr. Seif, a leading human rights lawyer, defended leftists, Islamists, atheists and gays.
item.dc:creator: By DOUGLAS MARTIN
item.media:description: Ahmed Seif in 2011. He was imprisoned at least four times under two Egyptian presidents.

item.title: Modi Rebukes Pakistan After Cancellation of Talks
item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India, speaking a week after high-level talks with Pakistan were called off, said Pakistani officials had made a “spectacle” of peace efforts by meeting with separatist leaders from the disputed Kashmir region.
item.dc:creator: By ELLEN BARRY

item.title: Quick History: Putin Rushes In, Pretending Not to; Obama Stands Back
item.description: Political spin and convenient lies surrounded the Ukraine crisis, while the difficult choices posed by ISIS remained unaddressed by President Obama.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By SERGE SCHMEMANN
item.media:description: A camouflaged pro-Russian tank seen in the town of Novoazovsk, in eastern Ukraine, last Friday.

item.title: World Briefing: Myanmar: Census Yields a Surprise
item.description: Myanmar has discovered that it has 51 million people — far less than the previously estimated 60 million.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing: Yemen: U.N. Body Condemns Instability
item.description: The United Nations Security Council on Friday called on Yemen’s Shiite Muslim Houthis to end hostilities against the government and warned foreign countries not to interfere by encouraging instability in Yemen.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By REUTERS
